title: Champion Concept;     Raxis: The Putrid Scavenger
body:
I'm not much of a number cruncher, so I'll leave the exact health/mana etc to people who know the game a little more intimately than I. Suffice to say this champion would have stats similar to someone like Talon or Wukong....high damage output in bursts with a bit of tank potential but not a sustained shredder like Riven or Fiora and certainly not a heavy brawler like Darius or Cho'Gath. My field is more the storytelling and descriptive parts of the character, so here's my idea for a new champion, Raxis: The Putrid Scavenger. 

Broken, welted skin, frayed stinking feathers and eyes red like demons blood, Raxis has long haunted the skies of Runeterra...his aching wail piercing the stagnant air of his surroundings as he searches constantly for leftover flesh to rake from the bone. Raxis is a tall, thin monstrosity, with bony arms and legs complete with long grasping talons, feathered wings like curtains torn straight from the blackness of midnight and a cursed hunger that never allows him to feel completely full. Raxis and his flock of fetid vultures have long performed cleanup duties for the endless slaughters that take place on Runeterra, but he has now invaded the League of Legends with hopes of an endless supply of gore to satiate his agonizing hunger. 

Gameplay:

Raxis is an assasin/fighter hybrid, excelling at separating high priority targets from mobs of adversaries while surveying the landscape for the dead and dying. 



Passive:  Gore Hunger
Nearby death excites Raxis, and encourages him to seek more. Every minion and monster that dies within his vicinity leaves behind a flesh pile, which can be collected up to a stack of 20. At 20 stacks, Raxis' basic attacks and abilities are empowered with a damage over time effect that decays after a short while. Raxis can also smell the deaths of large monsters in a vast area around him. 


Q:    Bone Break       12 second cooldown (activation window of 3 seconds, effect duration of 3 seconds, renewed for each successful bite)
Raxis empowers his next four basic attacks to shatter his preys bones, reducing their basic attack damage by a significant amount for a short time. The more times Raxis lands his bites, the more oppressive the damage reduction. 


W:    Victimize     9 second cooldown
Raxis launches himself at an enemy champion, monster or minion, driving them to the ground and mauling them for 1 second rendering them unable to attack or move. 


E:      Wing Blast      10 second cooldown
Raxis flaps his putrid wings hard, launching himself  backward and knocking back any enemy champions who stand near him. If Raxis has a target Victimised, he will carry the target with him, which can be used to increase the duration of the maul to 1.5 seconds.


R (Ultimate): Prey on the Helpless     90 second cooldown
Passive: All enemies below 35% health are visible to Raxis and his allies.
Active: Raxis leaps into the air and glides menacingly, reducing the vision and fearing anyone he glides over. Raxis is immune to basic attacks while gliding, but not abilities.


Thrives against: Vayne, Katarina, Aatrox, Nidalee, Teemo, Zed, Master Yi, Kallista

Agile champions that rely on their evasion to stay alive and dish out damage in a duel are going to have a tough time against Raxis. His Victimization combo (activate Q, attack with W, seperate with E) makes him an excellent counter to some of the leagues more slippery glass cannons and immobile mages. 

Struggles against: Lissandra, Leona, Mordekaiser, Trundle, Riven, Alistair, Amumu, Fiddlesticks

Champions such as these love nothing more than for their opponents to make it personal and get in close. Given the nature of Raxis' abilities, he will have a very difficult time dealing with champions who excel at creating their own battlefield and radiating powerful AOE disruption.

replies.body: There was a champion just recently made up top that could act as counter to this, with deamons attacking raxis and his health being drained in the prescience of that champion he could easily get himself killed with victimize.

the Q sounds really op '  reducing their basic attack damage by a significant amount for a short time ' this could be easily nerfed during the next patch if this champion releases, the ult '  reducing the vision and fearing anyone he glides over' i think this is quite unnecessary. this is just like the nocturne ult but with the fear. other then that i reckon this is a solid champ that i like to see and use if this champ gets released
The ult idea was the first crappy thing I thought of because it was 3AM and I was exhausted.

You need to add damage and some stats else its kind of hard to judge.

His R passive seems really unnecessary and the ult itself just doesn't fit and seems clunky. 

I like the synergy between the e and the w and I agree that his q needs to be a damage ability but the four auto thing just feels clunky and I don't see a reason why he should be able to reduce AD.

You are 100% right on both counts. I wanted his Q to be some sort of debilitating attack that serves to cripple enemies he victimizes and carries off, but I also needed him to be able to survive somewhat in a duel so he doesn't just get blown up. And honestly I couldn't even think of an ult, I just wanted some sort of gliding mechanic that looks cool. I still cant think of one that synergises well.
